query_text: In a family of Italian American descent in which 3 sibs had retinal dystrophy, juvenile cataracts, and short stature syndrome (RDJCSS; {616108}), {5:Xie et al. (2014)} identified compound heterozygosity for nonsense mutations in the RDH11 gene (R67X, {607849.0001}; R108X, {607849.0002}) that segregated with disease.
